recipe.title: Sour-Cream Pancakes with Sour-Cream Maple Syrup
ingredients: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into pieces
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, plus additional for cooking pancakes
instructions: Heat all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until butter has melted.

Make pancakes: Preheat oven to 200°F. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Whisk together sour cream, milk, egg, and melted butter (2 tablespoons), then whisk into flour mixture. Brush a 12-inch nonstick skillet with melted butter and heat over medium heat until hot. Working in batches, pour a scant 1/4 cup batter per pancake into skillet and cook until bubbles appear on surface and undersides are golden brown. Flip and cook other side, about 1 minute. Transfer to a baking sheet and keep warm in oven. Lightly butter skillet between batches. Serve pancakes with warm syrup.
